khosla.shapes

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • khosla.shapes.Shape
      • khosla.shapes.Line

  • public class Line
extends Shape
    This class represents a line.
    Version:
    September 19th 2017
    Author:
    mkhosla770

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Creates an instance of a Line connecting a point at x1, y1 to a point at x2, y2.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Checks if a Line object intersects with another

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line(double x1,
            double y1,
            double x2,
            double y2)
        Creates an instance of a Line connecting a point at x1, y1 to a point at x2, y2.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x coordinate of the first end point of the Line.
        y1 - The y coordinate of the first end point of the Line.
        x2 - The x coordinate of the second end point of the Line.
        y2 - The y coordinate of the second end point of the Line.

    • Method Detail

      • setPoint2

        public void setPoint2(double x2,
                      double y2)
        Sets the second end point of the Line to a point at x2, y2
        Parameters:
        x2 - The x coordinate of the new end point
        y2 - The y coordinate of the new end point

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
        Draws a new instance of a Line object with the first end point at xCoordinate1, yCoordinate1 and the second end point xCoordinate2, yCoordinate2
        Specified by:
        draw in class Shape
        Parameters:
        drawer - The PApplet used to draw the Line by accessing the processing package.
        Precondition:
        drawer must not be null
        Postcondition:
        stroke is set to black.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Line other)
        Checks if a Line object intersects with another
        Parameters:
        other - A Line object
        Returns:
        Whether or not the two lines intersect

      • verticalOrHorizontalOrPoint

        public int verticalOrHorizontalOrPoint(double x1,
                                       double y1,
                                       double x2,
                                       double y2)
        Checks if a Line object is vertical, horizontal, or a point.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x coordinate of the first end point of the line.
        y1 - The y coordinate of the first end point of the line.
        x2 - The x coordinate of the second end point of the line.
        y2 - The y coordinate of the second end point of the line.
        Returns:
        The number 1 if the line is vertical, the number 2 if the line is horizontal, and the number 3 if the line is a point.
